back: Performing operations on entire arrays at once instead of element by element, which speeds up computations (e.g., NumPy arrays).
Automatically expanding arrays of different shapes to a common shape so element-wise operations can be performed together (used in NumPy).

A language characteristic where variable types are checked at compile time and cannot change, requiring explicit type declarations (e.g., C, Java).
Functions or routines translated into machine code ahead of execution for faster performance compared to interpreting code line by line.
